name: White
description:
White is our basic t-shirt. 

STORY

White is the colour that the human eye sees when looking at light containing all the wavelengths. It is the colour of fresh milk and snow. It is often associated with innocence and purity in European culture. In Ancient Egypt, it was associated with the goddess Isis. Its priests wore only white linen. In ancient Greece, it was associated with mother's milk.  The early Christian church adopted the Roman symbolism of white as the color of purity, sacrifice and virtue.

FABRIC

50% Cotton 50% Modal. The composition of the fabric with modal fibers gives the t-shirt a super-soft aspect, as well as making it almost weightless that you might even forget you're wearing it.

name: Black Circle
description:
Black Circle is a suprematist t-shirt inspired by the drawings of Kazimir Malevich. The contrast between the white modal fabric and the thin layer of black ink on top creates a contrast that strengthens the identity of the t-shirt. Its simple but strong design makes it possible to wear it casually or at night outs. This piece is dedicated to a monumental perfect circle in black floating on a flat white background of fabric. It can be considered as a desperate struggle to free t-shirts from the ballast of the objective world.

STORY

Black Circle is a 1915 oil on canvas painting by the Russian Suprematist artist Kazimir Malevich. He removed any trace of figurature or representation from his paintings in favour of pure abstraction.

FABRIC

50% Cotton 50% Modal. The composition of the fabric with modal fibers gives the t-shirt a super-soft aspect, as well as making it almost weightless that you might even forget you're wearing it.

name: Montgolfière de diamond
description:
Montgolfière de diamond is a model evoking both simplicity and richness through the refined lines of an antique lead pencil. Although minimalist in the choice of colours, the subtle variation of shades of grey reminds us that the beauty is in the details.   

STORY 

Joseph-Michel Montgolfier and Jacques-Étienne Montgolfier invented the Montgolfière-style hot air balloon in 1783 in Annonay, France. Being the sons of a paper mill owner, they tried to float bags made of paper and fabric. On June 4, 1783, the brothers built a larger paper-lined silk balloon and displayed it in the marketplace at Annonay. The Mongolfière lifted 6562 feet into the air. 3 months later, the Montgolfière balloon carried its first passengers, a sheep, a rooster and a duck for eight minutes in Versailles in front of Louis XVI, Marie Antoinette and the French court.

FABRIC

50% Cotton 50% Modal. The composition of the fabric with modal fibers gives the t-shirt a super-soft aspect, as well as making it almost weightless that you might even forget you're wearing it.

name: DOG/GOD
description:
The Dog/God is a message t-shirt linking space to animals and astrology to biology. The naked anatomical depiction of the dog and its caption "dog" written through a nebula image poses questions about our origins and our place in the universe. A simple circle is drawn around the dog to accentuate the ideas of purity, centrality and sacredness. 

STORY

The original dog image is an anatomical engraving drawn by the illustrator Hermann Dittrich from the book Handbuch der Anatomie der Tiere für Künstler (1889) by Wilhelm Ellenberger and Hermann Baum.  The primary focus of the book is on the integumentary and musculoskeletal systems of the horse, cow, dog, lion, goat and deer. The images have an exquisite level of detail.

FABRIC

50% Cotton 50% Modal. The composition of the fabric with modal fibers gives the t-shirt a super-soft aspect, as well as making it almost weightless that you might even forget you're wearing it.

name: Tiger Duchess
description:
STORY

The original painting is a portrait of the Grand Duchess Olga Nikolaevna of Russia by the Belgian painter Nicaise de Keyser (1813-1887). She was the eldest daughter of the last autocratic ruler of the Russian Empire, Emperor Nicholas II. She was nursing the wounded soldiers in the military hospital during the World War I. After the Russian Revolution of 1917, she was captivated together with her family and murdered in 1918. 

The Russian Orthodox Church canonised Olga and her family as passion bearers in 2000. 

FABRIC

50% Cotton 50% Modal. The composition of the fabric with modal fibers gives the t-shirt a super-soft aspect, as well as making it almost weightless that you might even forget you're wearing it.

name: Venus of Orion
description:
Venus of Orion t-shirt is concieved as a window and bridge to the universal beauty. A rectangular window-like, black and white image of the Orion Constellation transforms itself into the symbol of absolute beauty, Venus de Milo, by subtle changes of hue, mostly towards pink and purple. 

STORY

Venus de Milo is one of the most famous works of an ancient Greek sculpture. Created sometime between 130-100 BC, it's believed to be the work of Alexandros of Antioch, depicting Aphrodite, the goddess of love and beauty.

Orion is a prominent constellation located on the celestial equator and visible throughout the world. Its pattern of stars is repeated in monuments throughout the ancient world, from Egypt to Mexico. It has been the center of the skies for our ancestors.

FABRIC

50% Cotton 50% Modal. The composition of the fabric with modal fibers gives the t-shirt a super-soft aspect, as well as making it almost weightless that you might even forget you're wearing it.

name: Ishtar Gate
description:
The Ishtar Gate was the eighth gate to the inner city of Babylon, constructed in  575BC by King Nebuchadnezzar II.

The massive gate itself is dedicated to the goddess of fertility and love, Ishtar represented by lions. Originally the gate, being part of the Walls of Babylon, was considered one of the Seven Wonders of the world until it was replaced by the Lighthouse of Alexandria; in the 3rd century BC.

name: THE IMMORTALS
description:
The Immortals were the elite soldiers of the King of kings, Darius I of the Achaemenid Empire. They played an important role in the conquest of Babylon, Egypt and western India and the Battle of Thermopylae against the alliance of Greek city-states.

The Frieze of Archers is from the Great Palace of Darius in Susa, Iran.

name: The Flammarion Engraving
description: The Flammarion engraving is a wood engraving by an unknown artist that first appeared in Camille Flammarion's L'atmosphère: météorologie populaire (1888). The image depicts a man crawling under the edge of the sky, depicted as if it were a solid hemisphere, to look at the mysterious Empyrean beyond. The caption translates to "A medieval missionary tells that he has found the point where heaven and Earth meet..."

name: Favela
description: A favela is the term for a shanty town in Brazil, most often within urban areas. The first favelas appeared in late 19th century and built by soldiers with nowhere to live. Favelas are built around the edge of the main city; so in a way, they are actually expanding the city. Communities form in favelas over time and often develop an array of social and religious organizations and forming associations to obtain such services as running water and electricity.

name: Paper Marbling
description: Paper marbling is an aqueous surface design technique that basically looks like capturing a galaxy on a page. Through several centuries, people have applied marbled materials to a variety of surfaces. It is often employed as a writing surface for calligraphy, and especially book covers and endpapers in bookbinding and stationery.

name: The Orion Nebula
description:
The Orion Nebula is a diffuse nebula situated south of Orion's Belt in the constellation of Orion. It is one of the brightest nebulae, and is visible to the naked eye in the night sky.

According to modern astronomers, the Orion Nebula is an enormous cloud of gas and dust, one of many in our Milky Way galaxy. It lies roughly 1,300 light-years from Earth.

At some 30 to 40 light-years in diameter, this great big nebulous cocoon is giving birth to perhaps a thousand stars.
